false_positive_patterns.pattern: Drugs that CAUSE the target condition as adverse effect
examples: Temsirolimus -> T2D (mTOR inhibitors cause 13-50% incidence of diabetes)
Paroxetine -> hypertension (SSRIs cause hypertension, WHO signal)
Isotretinoin -> rheumatoid arthritis (causes RA-like arthritis in 16-25%)
Vemurafenib -> rheumatoid arthritis (BRAF inhibitors cause arthralgia in 31-58%)
Digitoxin -> T2D (cardiac glycosides inhibit Na+/K+-ATPase, worsen glucose)
false_positive_patterns.recommendation: Cross-reference against FAERS adverse event database

false_positive_patterns.pattern: Targeted therapy for cancers lacking the target
examples: Trastuzumab -> melanoma (0% HER2 expression in melanoma)
false_positive_patterns.recommendation: Check target expression before predicting targeted therapies

examples: Diflorasone (topical) -> rheumatoid arthritis (topical steroids can't treat systemic disease)
Gemcitabine -> juvenile idiopathic arthritis (cytotoxic drugs inappropriate when biologics available)
false_positive_patterns.recommendation: Exclude cytotoxic chemotherapy for pediatric autoimmune conditions

key_validated_predictions.evidence: Clinical trial: superior to methotrexate alone
Phase II RCT: ACR20 36.1% vs 16.7% placebo (p=0.022)
RCT: 63.7% PASI reduction with cyclosporine combo
Phase I/II: 88% response with TLD regimen
Meta-analysis: -1.42 mmHg SBP, modest but significant

filter_rules_to_add: mTOR inhibitors (temsirolimus, everolimus, sirolimus) for metabolic diseases -> EXCLUDE
Alpha-2 antagonist antidepressants (mirtazapine) for hypertension -> EXCLUDE
HER2-targeted drugs for HER2-negative cancers -> EXCLUDE
Topical steroids for systemic diseases -> EXCLUDE
